meanings.definition: The practice of transcribing speech sounds into written symbols.
meanings.sent1: In phonography, experts convert spoken words into written text.
meanings.sent2: I learned about phonography in school, where we wrote down the sounds we heard.
meanings.sent3: The detective used phonography to decode the secret message hidden in the audio recording.
meanings.sent4: Her phonography skills were so sharp, she could transcribe any language accurately.
meanings.sent5: The art of phonography made the ancient stories come alive on paper.

meanings.definition: The art or process of recording sound, especially for reproduction or broadcast.
meanings.sent1: The studio was equipped with the latest phonography equipment for music recording.
meanings.sent2: We studied phonography to understand how to capture clear audio for the radio show.
meanings.sent3: The birds outside provided a natural soundtrack for the film, thanks to phonography.
meanings.sent4: His phonography work in the concert hall captured the essence of the live performance.
meanings.sent5: The phonography of the rainstorm added a calming ambiance to the meditation track.

meanings.definition: The study of sound waves and their properties.
meanings.sent1: In phonography class, we learned about the different types of sound waves.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use phonography to explore how sound travels through different mediums.
meanings.sent3: The professor's passion for phonography made the subject fascinating to the students.
meanings.sent4: The intricate patterns of sound waves fascinated her, leading her to pursue phonography.
meanings.sent5: Through phonography, we can understand the complexities of sound and its behavior.
